TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebPartManagerInternals extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Isolates into a separate class methods that are used by the control and can be overridden by developers who extend the control, but are rarely needed by page developers.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class is the largest class in the Web Parts control set. It is also among the most important Web Parts classes because it is used on every Web page that contains Web Parts controls, and it coordinates and manages all Web Parts controls on a page.
Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class is used so frequently, and because it contains so many exposed methods, some methods needed mostly by control developers who are extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control are contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class. This isolation of less-used methods into the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class simplifies the API of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, and the isolated methods do not appear on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> object in IntelliSense.
Developers who use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class are likely to have scenarios where they need to inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control and customize it extensively. For example, if you are building a Web portal application or a packaged set of Web Parts controls with custom display modes, custom zones, custom verbs, custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, and other extensions of the base Web Parts user interface (UI), in many cases (not all) you will need to override and extend some of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> members. And although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class is sealed so you cannot inherit from it, your custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class will likely need to call a number of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> methods in order to manage Web Parts controls on a page.
> [!NOTE] > Like the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class provides a server control that has no UI and is never visible on a page. Unlike <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class is never declared in the markup of a page; it is strictly a worker object that performs background tasks. The typical way of using it is demonstrated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> class, which references it by means of the protected <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Internals%2A> property, and uses the referenced object to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> methods.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> class contains only methods; there are no properties or events. All the methods in the class involve managing <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, or connections between controls.
To handle <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> includes methods for adding them (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.AddWebPart%2A>), removing them <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.RemoveWebPart%2A>), handling events <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.CallOnDeleting%2A>), getting or setting details about their relationship to their zone (for example, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetZoneIndex%2A>), or setting basic <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control properties (for example, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsClosed%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasSharedData%2A>).
To handle connections, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals> includes methods for deleting them (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.DeleteConnection%2A>), setting which transformer object to use (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A>), setting whether a connection is shared and whether it is static (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29>), and setting a connection error message to use (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetConnectErrorMessage%2A>).

remarks.format: ## Remarks The method uses the <xref:System.CodeDom.Compiler.CodeGenerator> class to create the type, an alternative that offers better performance than using the <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void DeleteConnection(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection connection) cil managed

Docs.param: A that has been selected for deletion.
Docs.summary: Sets a property to indicate that the specified connection object has been deleted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.DeleteConnection%2A> method is one step in the process of terminating an existing connection between two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> or other server controls on a Web page. It sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.ConnectionDeleted%2A> property value to `true` to indicate that `connection` is deleted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance string GetZoneID(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: A that resides in a zone.
Docs.summary: Gets the ID of a zone that contains the specified or server control.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the ID of the zone that contains .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> method returns the ID of the zone that contains the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Zone%2A> property of `webPart` references the actual zone object that contains `webPart`, not the ID of the zone. If `webPart` is currently closed, the value of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.Zone%2A> property is `null`, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.GetZoneID%2A> method will return the ID of the last zone that `webPart` was in prior to being closed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveWebPart(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart) cil managed

Docs.param: A or other server control to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes a or other server control from the control's collection of controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Removes `webPart` from the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control's collection of Web Parts controls that it maintains for the page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object SaveConfigurationState(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer transformer) cil managed
Public Function SaveConfigurationState (transformer As WebPartTransformer) As Object

Docs.param: A that is used to connect controls.
Docs.summary: Saves state data for a object that participates in a connection between controls.
Docs.returns: An that contains the saved state data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SaveConfigurationState%2A> method saves configuration data that is created when a user configures a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> control on a Web page as part of a connection between controls. This configuration data is then reloaded each time the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> control is rendered, by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.LoadConfigurationState%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetConnectErrorMessage (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, string connectErrorMessage);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetConnectErrorMessage(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, string connectErrorMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: A that participates in a connection with another control.
A string that contains the text of the error message.
Docs.summary: Establishes an errors message, and causes the object that is responsible for rendering a control to render that message rather than the contents of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetConnectErrorMessage%2A> method allows you to associate an error message with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control that participates in connections. If an error occurs when another control is forming a connection with the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter, then after the connection process has failed, the error message is displayed in the user interface (UI), rather than the contents of `webPart`.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartChrome> object associated with `webPart` renders the error message in its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartChrome.RenderPartContents%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetHasSharedData (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool hasSharedData);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetHasSharedData(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool hasSharedData) cil managed

Docs.param: A or other server control that can have shared personalization data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether has shared data.
Docs.summary: Sets a property on a or other server control indicating whether the control has shared personalization data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasSharedData%2A> method indicates whether `webPart` has shared personalization data. The value of the `hasSharedData` parameter that is passed into the method is assigned to the `webPart` control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.HasSharedData%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetHasUserData (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool hasUserData);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetHasUserData(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool hasUserData) cil managed

Docs.param: A or other server control that can have user personalization data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether has shared data.
Docs.summary: Sets a property on a or other server control indicating whether the control has user personalization data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetHasUserData%2A> method indicates whether `webPart` has individual user personalization data, as opposed to shared data. The method assigns the value of the `hasUserData` parameter to the `webPart` control's <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.HasUserData%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIsClosed (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isClosed);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetIsClosed(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isClosed) cil managed

Docs.param: A for which this method sets the property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a is closed on a page.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsClosed%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsClosed%2A> property of `webPart`. This method does not actually close `webPart`; it only sets the property that indicates whether `webPart` is closed.

Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control or the property of a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%2A> method calls a method in a base class to set a property that indicates whether a particular instance of a control is shared. In the Web Parts control set, a shared control means a control that is visible to all users of a page. This is in contrast to a per-user control, which is visible only to the specific user who added the control to the page.
> [!NOTE] > For more on personalization and shared versus per-user controls, see [Web Parts Personalization Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/z36h8be9(v=vs.100)).

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIsShared (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isShared);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetIsShared(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isShared) cil managed

Docs.param: A for which this method sets the property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether is shared.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%2A> method does not actually cause the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter to be shared; it only sets the property that indicates whether `webPart` is currently shared.

Public Sub SetIsShared (connection As WebPartConnection, isShared As Boolean)

Docs.param: A between two controls.
A Boolean value that indicates whether is shared.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsShared%2A> method does not actually cause the control referenced by the `connection` parameter to be shared; it only sets the property that indicates whether `connection` is currently shared.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIsStandalone (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isStandalone);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetIsStandalone(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isStandalone) cil managed

Docs.param: A for which this method sets the property.
A Boolean value that indicates whether is a standalone control.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStandalone%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStandalone%2A> property. When this property is set to `true` on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control, it means that the control is not contained within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zone.

Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control or the property of a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%2A> method calls a method in a base class to set a property that indicates whether a particular instance of a control is static. In the Web Parts control set, a static control is a control that is declared in the markup of a Web page. This is in contrast to a dynamic control, which is either added to a page programmatically, or added by a user from a catalog of controls. A static control is inherently a shared control, meaning that it is visible to all users of a page, and although users can close a static control, they can never delete (permanently remove) it.
> [!NOTE] > For more on personalization, static versus dynamic controls, and shared versus per-user controls, see [Web Parts Personalization Overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/aspnet/z36h8be9(v=vs.100)).

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIsStatic (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isStatic);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetIsStatic(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, bool isStatic) cil managed

Docs.param: The control for which the property value is being set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether is static.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart.IsStatic%2A> property value of the control referenced by the `webPart` parameter. If `webPart` is declared within a zone in the markup of a Web page, this method sets the property value to `true`. If `webPart` is added to a page programmatically, or by a user through the Web Parts user interface (UI), then this method sets the property value to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIsStatic (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection connection, bool isStatic);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetIsStatic(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection connection, bool isStatic) cil managed
Public Sub SetIsStatic (connection As WebPartConnection, isStatic As Boolean)

Docs.param: The connection for which the property value is being set.
A Boolean value that indicates whether is static.
Docs.summary: Sets the property of a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetIsStatic%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method is used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection.IsStatic%2A> property value of the connection referenced by the `connection` parameter. If `connection` is declared in the markup of a Web page, this method sets the property value to `true`. If `connection` is added to a page programmatically, or by a user through the Web Parts user interface (UI), then this method sets the property value to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetTransformer(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection connection, class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer transformer) cil managed
Public Sub SetTransformer (connection As WebPartConnection, transformer As WebPartTransformer)

Docs.param: A that creates a connection between server controls.
A to be used with .
Docs.summary: Assigns a object to be used in a connection between two server controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a connection between two server controls requires a transformer so that the consumer control can interpret data from the provider control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A> method is called to supply a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartConnection> object. If the connection already has a transformer assigned to it, the object referenced by the `transformer` parameter overrides the existing one; otherwise, the object referenced in the `transformer` parameter is used.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetTransformer%2A> method whenever you call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.ConnectWebParts%2A> method to establish a connection that requires a transformer.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetZoneID (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, string zoneID);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetZoneID(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, string zoneID) cil managed

Docs.param: The whose property value is being set.
A string that contains the ID of the zone that belongs to.
Docs.summary: Sets a property that enables a or server control to keep the ID of the containing zone.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control is being added to a zone. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control tracks the ID for the zone it belongs to, and this method sets the property that keeps the ID value.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetZoneIndex (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, int zoneIndex);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetZoneIndex(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart webPart, int32 zoneIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: A control for which the method sets a zone index.
The index of within its zone relative to other controls in the zone.
Docs.summary: Sets the index of the specified control within its zone relative to the other controls within the zone.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerInternals.SetZoneIndex%2A> method determines the ordinal position that `webPart` occupies in its zone, relative to other server controls in the zone.
